description: {"blocks":[{"key":"7n8ql","text":"This is the instructor protocol for","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2uh1b","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"22qd1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6sh1k","text":"The protocol is pretty straightforward, but I have included several common student errors to watch out for!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":66113,"title":"Agarose gel electrophoresis","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eAgarose gel electrophoresis\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"agarose-gel-electrophoresis-ccs9swh6","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ie47bvh6p.jpg","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/ie47bvh6p.jpg","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Brian    Teague","affiliation":"University of Wisconsin - Stout","affiliation_url":"teagueb@uwstout.edu","username":"brian----teague","link":"https://teague.bio","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/012.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/012.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":20},"type_id":1,"guid":"82A80EA019AA11EDA5A969965F9AEEBA"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2msl4","text":"Make LAB buffer following this recipe:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab6om","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ds5qf","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"v1tb","text":"For a class of 24, I usually prepare 6x   bottles of 1X LAB. We go through a lot -- there are three gels that get run over the course of the semester, plus repeats.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"p4p1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"protocols","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"id":66462,"title":"LAB Agarose Gel Electrophoresis Buffer Recipe","title_html":"\u003cp\u003eLAB Agarose Gel Electrophoresis Buffer Recipe\u003c/p\u003e","load_collapsed":true,"uri":"lab-agarose-gel-electrophoresis-buffer-recipe-cc56sy9e","image":{"source":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iezebvh6p.jpg","webp_source":null,"placeholder":"https://s3.amazonaws.com/protocols-files/files/iezebvh6p.jpg","webp_placeholder":null},"creator":{"name":"Brian    Teague","affiliation":"University of Wisconsin - Stout","affiliation_url":"teagueb@uwstout.edu","username":"brian----teague","link":"https://teague.bio","image":{"source":"/img/avatars/012.png","placeholder":"/img/avatars/012.png","webp_source":""}},"stats":{"number_of_steps":5},"type_id":1,"guid":"088932D019A911EDA5A969965F9AEEBA"}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"E1BC60E019A911EDA5A969965F9AEEBA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":3}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7l20h","text":"Instructor Tips","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1coig","text":"The benefit of using LAB is the ability to run gels at higher voltage -- our \"mini\" gel tanks go at 120 V for 20 minutes and get pretty decent gels. It is totally possible to cast, load and run an LAB gel in 2 hours.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"63ju5","text":"I usually demonstrate the proper assembly of the gel tank","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1phoc","text":"Gels with Sybr Safe are fine in the refrigerator for 48 hours, but much longer than that and the stain degrades too much. That is -- a gel cast on Tuesday will be fine for a lab on Thursday, but not the other way around. To store a gel, put it in a zipper sandwich baggie and add a splash (not more) of LAB buffer. Label and store at  in the refrigerator.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":334,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"e1l6l","text":"A common student error is to forget the DNA stain. But all is not lost -- you can post-stain these gels. Put the gel in a small container (a tip box lid is often fine), cover with LAB, add   of Sybr Safe, and put on a slow rocker or orbital shaker.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":189,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6b9sr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"5BC03AA019AB11EDA5A969965F9AEEBA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"5","error":false,"guid":"8BBC2A2019AB11EDA5A969965F9AEEBA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fansn","text":"Common Student Errors","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3h8o3","text":"Forgot to add the DNA stain","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cg1al","text":"Didn't 100% dissolve the agarose (it should be CLEAR AS WATER, no flecks floating around in it)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"106mm","text":"Ran the gel backward (remember, \"run to red\")","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab9ad","text":"Only ran   of the restriction digest (instead of the whole digest)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3skid","text":"Alternately, ran the entire PCR (instead of just  ) -- leaving not enough to purify.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":49,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8kaf5","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"4391526019AC11EDA5A969965F9AEEBA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"55908F8019AC11EDA5A969965F9AEEBA","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}}}}

title: Agarose Gel Electrophoresis (Instructor Protocol)
warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"p0jd","text":"Lithium acetate: May cause eye and skin irritation. May cause respiratory and digestive tract irritation. The toxicological properties of this material have not been fully investigated.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b1g0o","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"523rb","text":"Boric acid: May damage fertility. May damage the unborn child.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c65ko","text":"\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8i2vg","text":"Wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE), including a lab coat, nitrile gloves and safety glasses.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
